required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Post-Marketing Surveillance (Use-results Surveillance) With Esperoct®. A Multi-centre, Prospective, Observational, Non-interventional Post-marketing Study to Investigate the Long-term Safety and Effectiveness of Esperoct® in Haemophilia A Patients Under Routine Clinical Practice Conditions in Japan

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and effectiveness of Esperoct® for long-term routine use in patients with Haemophilia A. Participants will get Esperoct® as prescribed by their doctor. The study will last for about 2 years for each participant.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse reactions (ARs) reported during the observation period
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of serious adverse events (SAEs) reported during the observation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of serious adverse reactions (SARs) reported during the observation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who have confirmed inhibitory antibodies against FVIII during the observation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of bleeding episodes requiring treatment for patients using Esperoct® during the observation period assessed by annual bleeding rate (ABR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the haemostatic response of Esperoct® measured as number of successes for treatment requiring bleeds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)
secondary_outcome.description: Count, assessed based on a four-point scale (excellent, good, moderate and poor) by counting excellent and good as success and moderate and poor as failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the haemostatic response of Esperoct® measured as number of successes in treatment of bleeds in perioperative management during surgical procedures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (week 0) to end of study (week 104)
secondary_outcome.description: Count, assessed as success/failure based on a four-point scale for haemostatic response (excellent, good, moderate and poor) by counting excellent and good as success and moderate and poor as failure

arm_group.description: New patients who have not previously been exposed to Esperoct® (Turoctocog alfa pegol or N8-GP in clinical trials) are eligible for this study.

intervention.description: Patients will be treated with commercially available Esperoct® according to routine clinical practice at the discretion of the treating physician. The decision to initiate treatment with commercially available Esperoct® has been made by the patient/Legally Acceptable Representative (LAR) and the treating physician before and independently from the decision to include the patient in this study.

study_pop.textblock: Haemophilia A patients in routine clinical practice in Japan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed consent obtained before any study-related activities (study-related activities are any procedure related to recording of data according to the protocol).
- The decision to initiate treatment with commercially available Esperoct® has been made by the patient/Legally Acceptable Representative (LAR) and the treating physician before and independently from the decision to include the patient in this study.
- Diagnosis of haemophilia A in males or females, no age limitation.
- New patients who have not previously been exposed to Esperoct®.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in this study. Participation is defined as having given informed consent in this study.
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to study product or related products.
- Mental incapacity, unwillingness or language barriers precluding adequate understanding or cooperation.

patient_data.ipd_description: According to the Novo Nordisk disclosure commitment on novonordisk-trials.com
